learning_path: Fundamentals: Python programming, linear algebra, probability & statistics
Data manipulation with Pandas and NumPy
SQL for data querying
Supervised and unsupervised learning with scikit-learn
Deep learning basics with TensorFlow or PyTorch
Model deployment basics (Flask/FastAPI, Docker)
projects: End-to-end Kaggle-style project: dataset cleaning → modeling → deployment
data scientist.notes: Focus on practical projects and a small portfolio to demonstrate skills.

learning_path: C# basics and OOP concepts
Build web APIs with ASP.NET Core
Work with databases using Entity Framework
Learn unit/integration testing (xUnit)
Deploy to Azure and learn CI/CD pipelines
projects: Microservice that integrates with SQL and exposes endpoints
Deploy an app to Azure App Service with CI/CD
.net.notes: Map .NET knowledge to job descriptions in your region and build a deployable app.

learning_path: Phase 1: Python fundamentals (6-8 weeks) - variables, loops, functions, OOP basics
Phase 2: Selenium WebDriver (4-6 weeks) - installation, basic script, element interactions, waits
Phase 3: Test Design Patterns (3-4 weeks) - Page Object Model, identifying flaky tests, best practices
Phase 4: pytest and Test Organization (2-3 weeks) - runners, fixtures, reporting, test suites
Phase 5: CI/CD Integration (2-3 weeks) - running tests in pipelines, parallel execution, artifacts
projects: Project 1 (Weeks 1-3): Automate 5-10 test cases on a public website using Selenium + pytest
Project 2 (Weeks 4-6): Build a Page Object Model framework with 20+ test cases
Project 3 (Weeks 7-10): Create a regression test suite for an e-commerce app (login, search, checkout)
Project 4 (Weeks 11-14): Integrate tests into CI pipeline with parallel execution and HTML reports
selenium python.career_path: QA Automation Engineer → Test Architect → Engineering Manager
selenium python.job_market: High demand (especially in fintech, e-commerce, enterprise software)
selenium python.notes: Focus on writing reliable, maintainable tests. Learn to diagnose and fix flaky tests. Build a GitHub portfolio with 2-3 real test projects showing POM implementation and CI integration.

learning_path: Leverage existing programming skills (JavaScript/Node/Backend)
Learn Python for data: Pandas and NumPy
Study statistics and ML fundamentals
Build 2-3 ML projects showing business impact
Learn model deployment and monitoring
projects: Build a product recommendation model using backend data
Deploy a simple ML model behind an API
fullstack to data scientist.notes: Use your fullstack background to ship ML-enabled features quickly.

learning_path: JavaScript fundamentals and modern ES6+ features
React basics and component patterns
State management with Redux or Context
TypeScript for safer code
Frontend testing and performance optimization
projects: Single-page application with routing and state
frontend developer.notes: Build polished UI projects and include accessibility checks.

learning_path: JavaScript/Node fundamentals
Build REST and GraphQL APIs
Database modeling with SQL
Caching and background jobs
Containerize and deploy services
projects: RESTful API with auth and DB
Deploy using Docker and a cloud provider
backend developer.notes: Focus on reliable APIs and clear documentation.

learning_path: SQL and data modeling
Python for data pipelines
Build ETL with Airflow
Process large datasets with Spark
Streaming basics with Kafka
projects: End-to-end ETL pipeline into a data warehouse
Build streaming ingest into analytics store
data engineer.notes: Emphasize reliability, monitoring, and cost-aware design.

learning_path: Deepen ML fundamentals and production concerns
Learn model packaging and serving
Work with Docker and Kubernetes
Implement CI for ML and monitoring
projects: Deploy an ML model with autoscaling
Implement end-to-end ML pipeline with monitoring
ml engineer.notes: Bridge ML research and production reliability.

Orchestrate containers with Kubernetes
Automate infra with Terraform

Build apps with SwiftUI or UIKit
Persistence and networking
Test and distribute via App Store

learning_path: Fundamentals: Product management principles, user-centric thinking
Discovery: Market research, user research, competitive analysis
Definition: Requirements gathering, product roadmapping, PRD writing
Development: Agile collaboration, technical understanding basics
Launch: Go-to-market strategy, metrics definition, feedback loops
Growth: Data analysis, optimization, scaling, business strategy
projects: Product roadmap creation for new feature
product manager.career_path: Associate Product Manager → Product Manager → Senior Product Manager → Director of Product
product manager.job_market: Very high demand; companies need PMs for growth and product development
product manager.notes: Critical business role that bridges engineering, design, and business teams

learning_path: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2): Software Testing Fundamentals - types of testing, test cases, SDLC
Phase 2 (Weeks 3-6): Python Basics - variables, loops, functions, OOP, file handling
Phase 3 (Weeks 7-12): Selenium WebDriver - installation, element identification, navigation, interactions
Phase 4 (Weeks 13-16): Wait Strategies - implicit waits, explicit waits, handling timeouts
Phase 5 (Weeks 17-20): Page Object Model - framework design, test organization, best practices
Phase 6 (Weeks 21-24): pytest & Test Management - fixtures, runners, reports, parallel execution
Phase 7 (Weeks 25-28): CI/CD Integration - Jenkins/GitHub Actions, automated test execution, artifact generation
projects: Project 1 (Week 8): Automate 10 test cases on demo.opencart.com (login, search, add to cart)
Project 2 (Week 14): Build POM framework with 30+ test cases for e-commerce site
Project 3 (Week 20): Complete regression suite (UI + API smoke tests) with cross-browser support
Project 4 (Week 28): Integrate tests into GitHub Actions with scheduled execution, Slack notifications, HTML reports
qa automation.career_path: QA Automation Engineer → Senior Automation Engineer → Test Architect → QA Manager
qa automation.job_market: High demand globally, especially in fintech, e-commerce, healthcare, and enterprise software
qa automation.notes: Focus on writing maintainable, reliable tests. Learn to debug flaky tests. Build a GitHub portfolio with 2-3 production-grade test projects. Key success factor: strong debugging and problem-solving skills. Employers value candidates who understand root cause of test failures and can architect scalable test frameworks.

learning_path: Learn Python fundamentals for QA
Master Selenium WebDriver
Understand wait strategies and synchronization
Implement Page Object Model
Design and execute automated test suites
Integrate with CI/CD pipelines
projects: Build automated test suite for a web application
Create reusable test framework with POM
Set up automated tests in CI pipeline
prerequisite_skills: Basic programming knowledge or willingness to learn
test automation engineer.career_path: Test Automation Engineer → Senior Test Automation Engineer → QA Lead
test automation engineer.notes: Similar to QA Automation Engineer. Focus on framework design and test reliability.

learning_path: Python programming basics
Selenium WebDriver fundamentals
Element identification and interaction
Wait strategies
Building test cases with pytest
CI/CD integration
selenium testing.career_path: Selenium Testing Engineer → QA Automation Engineer → Test Architect
selenium testing.job_market: Good demand, especially for e-commerce and SaaS
selenium testing.notes: Specialized role focused on Selenium automation. Emphasize framework reliability and maintainability.

learning_path: Phase 1: C# fundamentals (4-6 weeks) - syntax, OOP, LINQ
Phase 2: Selenium WebDriver with C# (4-6 weeks) - setup, basic scripts, element interactions
Phase 3: Test frameworks (2-4 weeks) - NUnit, SpecFlow, assertions, test runners
Phase 4: Framework design (2-3 weeks) - POM, reusable helpers, reporting
Phase 5: CI/CD integration (2-3 weeks) - pipelines, scheduled runs, artifact management
projects: Automate 5-10 test cases using Selenium + NUnit in C#
Build POM framework in C# with SpecFlow scenarios
Integrate tests into Azure DevOps pipeline with reports
selenium csharp.career_path: QA Automation Engineer (C#) → Senior Automation Engineer → Test Architect
selenium csharp.notes: For teams using Microsoft stack, C# is preferred. Emphasize strong C# fundamentals.

learning_path: Phase 1: Excel essentials and data cleaning (2-3 weeks)
Phase 2: SQL for data querying (3-4 weeks)
Phase 3: Python for data analysis (4-6 weeks) - pandas, numpy
Phase 4: Visualization and dashboards (2-3 weeks) - Power BI/ Tableau
projects: Clean and analyze a dataset in Excel and present findings
Create SQL reports from sample databases
Build a Power BI dashboard showcasing KPIs
document specialist to data analyst.notes: Leverage domain knowledge from document work; focus on transferable skills like attention to detail and data quality.

learning_path: Phase 1: HTML & CSS and responsive design (2-3 weeks)
Phase 2: JavaScript fundamentals (3-4 weeks)
Phase 3: React basics and component patterns (4-6 weeks)
Phase 4: Build portfolio and deploy (2-3 weeks)
projects: Create a responsive portfolio website showcasing edited photos
Build a React gallery app with filtering and lightbox
Deploy site to Netlify or GitHub Pages
photo editor to frontend developer.notes: Design sensibility from photo editing is an advantage; focus on UX and polished UI.

learning_path: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2): SQL fundamentals - SELECT, WHERE, JOIN, GROUP BY, aggregates
Phase 2 (Weeks 3-5): Advanced queries - subqueries, CTEs, window functions, complex joins
Phase 3 (Weeks 6-8): Database design - normalization, ER diagrams, constraints, relationships
Phase 4 (Weeks 9-11): Stored procedures and triggers - writing, debugging, performance
Phase 5 (Weeks 12-14): Query optimization - execution plans, indexing strategies, EXPLAIN
Phase 6 (Weeks 15-17): Database administration - backups, recovery, user management, maintenance
Phase 7 (Weeks 18-20): SQL Server/PostgreSQL specific features and cloud databases
projects: Project 1: Design and normalize a database for an e-commerce system (products, orders, customers, inventory)
Project 2: Write 50+ optimized queries for business analytics (sales reports, customer segmentation, trend analysis)
Project 3: Create stored procedures and triggers for order processing with transaction handling
Project 4: Build ETL pipeline extracting data from multiple sources, transforming with SQL, loading into warehouse
Project 5: Performance tuning project - analyze slow queries, identify missing indexes, optimize execution plans
sql engineer.career_path: Junior SQL Developer → Senior SQL Developer → Database Architect → Database Administrator
sql engineer.job_market: Consistently high demand across all industries (finance, healthcare, e-commerce, SaaS)
sql engineer.notes: SQL is a cornerstone skill for data-intensive roles. Strong SQL fundamentals open doors to data engineering, analytics, and backend development. Focus on writing efficient queries and understanding execution plans. Real-world projects with 1M+ row datasets are impressive on portfolios.

learning_path: Start with fundamentals
Practice small projects
Build portfolio
generic.notes: If unsure, start with fundamentals and then specialize.

learning_path: Fundamentals: Business analysis principles, SDLC understanding
Requirements: Elicitation techniques, documentation, validation

Analysis: Gap analysis, impact assessment, solution design

Tools: Jira, diagramming tools, BI tools, SQL for data validation

compliance risk officer.notes: Critical role in regulated industries. Continuous learning required.

learning_path: Phase 1: Data privacy regulations (2-3 weeks)
Phase 2: Privacy engineering (2-3 weeks)
Phase 3: Technical privacy solutions (2-3 weeks)
Phase 4: Privacy architecture (1-2 weeks)
Phase 5: Privacy governance (1-2 weeks)
data privacy engineer.career_path: Privacy Engineer → Senior Privacy Engineer → DPO
data privacy engineer.notes: Specialized field. Combines legal and technical expertise.

learning_path: Phase 1: Enterprise architecture basics (2 weeks)
Phase 2: TOGAF and frameworks (3-4 weeks)
Phase 3: Cloud and integration (2-3 weeks)
Phase 4: Governance and strategy (2 weeks)
Phase 5: Real-world transformation (ongoing)
enterprise architect.career_path: Senior Architect → Enterprise Architect → Chief Architect
enterprise architect.notes: Strategic role. Requires broad experience and business understanding.

learning_path: Phase 1: Kubernetes and containers (3-4 weeks)
Phase 2: Infrastructure as code (2-3 weeks)
Phase 3: CI/CD and automation (2-3 weeks)
Phase 4: Developer experience design (2 weeks)
Phase 5: Platform operations (ongoing)
platform engineer.career_path: DevOps Engineer → Platform Engineer → Platform Lead
platform engineer.job_market: Very high demand in tech companies
platform engineer.notes: Growing specialization. Focus on developer experience and DX.

learning_path: Phase 1: Core cloud services (3-4 weeks)
Phase 2: Architecture and design patterns (3-4 weeks)
Phase 3: Security and compliance (2-3 weeks)
Phase 4: Cost optimization (1-2 weeks)
Phase 5: Advanced specializations (ongoing)
cloud architect aws azure gcp.career_path: Cloud Engineer → Cloud Architect → Principal Architect
cloud architect aws azure gcp.notes: Master one cloud deeply first. Cloud certifications valuable.

learning_path: Phase 1: Integration patterns (2-3 weeks)
Phase 2: API design and management (2-3 weeks)
Phase 3: Message-driven architecture (2-3 weeks)
Phase 4: Enterprise integration tools (2-3 weeks)
Phase 5: Complex integrations (ongoing)
integration architect.career_path: Integration Engineer → Integration Architect → Enterprise Architect
integration architect.notes: Critical for enterprise systems. Complex systems experience valued.

learning_path: Python basics: syntax, data structures, OOP
Web framework fundamentals (Flask or Django)
Database design and SQLAlchemy
RESTful API design patterns
Testing and debugging
Deployment and DevOps basics
projects: Build a RESTful API with Flask/Django
Create a full-stack Python web application
python developer.career_path: Python Developer → Senior Python Developer → Tech Lead
python developer.job_market: Very high demand across startups and enterprises
python developer.notes: Python is versatile - used in web, data, automation, and scripting.

learning_path: TypeScript fundamentals and concepts
Angular basics: components, templates, directives
Services and dependency injection
Reactive programming with RxJS
Routing and lazy loading
State management and advanced patterns
projects: Build a complete Angular application with routing
Create a responsive Angular material interface
angular developer.career_path: Angular Developer → Senior Angular Developer → Frontend Tech Lead
angular developer.notes: Angular dominates in enterprise frontend development.

learning_path: Phase 1: Testing fundamentals - SDLC, testing types, documentation
Phase 2: Manual testing - Test cases, execution, defect reporting
Phase 3: Automation basics - Selenium, element locators, waits
Phase 4: Advanced automation - Page Object Model, frameworks, CI/CD
Phase 5: Performance and API testing - JMeter, Postman
Phase 6: DevOps integration - Jenkins, Docker, test pipelines
projects: Build automated test suite for e-commerce website (10+ test cases)
Create Page Object Model framework with multiple test scenarios
Develop API test automation using Postman and Newman
Setup CI/CD pipeline with Jenkins for automated test execution
software testing engineer.career_path: QA Engineer → Automation Engineer → QA Lead → QA Manager
software testing engineer.job_market: Very high demand, growing with DevOps and continuous testing
software testing engineer.notes: Automation testing is increasingly critical in agile development. Strong demand for SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) roles.

learning_path: Phase 1: QA fundamentals - SDLC, QA roles, test planning
Phase 2: Manual testing - Test case design, bug reporting
Phase 3: Testing tools - JIRA, TestRail, documentation tools
Phase 4: Automation introduction - Selenium basics
Phase 5: Automation frameworks - TestNG, data-driven testing
Phase 6: Mobile and API testing
projects: Create comprehensive test plan for web application
Execute functional testing and create defect reports
Build automation suite for critical user journeys
Perform regression testing for application updates
qa engineer.career_path: QA Engineer → Senior QA Engineer → QA Analyst → QA Manager
qa engineer.job_market: Consistently high demand across all industries
qa engineer.notes: Manual QA skills are always in demand. Transitioning to automation increases earning potential significantly.

learning_path: Phase 1: Programming fundamentals - Java/Python basics
Phase 2: Selenium basics - Finding elements, interactions, waits
Phase 3: Test frameworks - TestNG, test organization, assertions
Phase 4: Page Object Model - Creating robust, maintainable tests
Phase 5: BDD and Cucumber - Gherkin syntax, feature files
Phase 6: CI/CD and DevOps - Jenkins, Docker, test execution pipelines
projects: Build cross-browser test suite using Selenium
Implement BDD framework with Cucumber for business requirements
Create API test automation with REST Assured or pytest-requests
Setup automated test execution in CI/CD pipeline
automation testing engineer.career_path: Automation Engineer → Senior Automation Engineer → SDET → Engineering Manager
automation testing engineer.job_market: High demand, especially for SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) roles
automation testing engineer.notes: SDET roles are the future of QA. Strong programming skills combined with testing knowledge is highly valued.

learning_path: Phase 1: Software engineering fundamentals - Design patterns, architecture
Phase 2: Advanced automation - Frameworks, scalability, reliability
Phase 3: DevOps skills - Docker, Kubernetes, cloud platforms
Phase 4: CI/CD mastery - Pipeline design, infrastructure as code
Phase 5: Performance and security testing - Load testing, security scanning
Phase 6: Leadership - Mentoring, architecture decisions, best practices
projects: Design and build scalable test automation framework
Implement multi-cloud test infrastructure with Docker/Kubernetes
Create performance testing suite with JMeter or Gatling
Build custom CI/CD pipeline with advanced reporting
sdet (software development engineer in t.career_path: SDET → Senior SDET → Principal Engineer → Engineering Manager
sdet (software development engineer in t.notes: SDET is the highest-paying QA role. Combines deep engineering skills with testing expertise.

learning_path: Phase 1: Mobile app fundamentals - iOS and Android architecture
Phase 2: Manual mobile testing - Device testing, emulators, real devices
Phase 3: Appium automation - iOS and Android test automation
Phase 4: Native frameworks - XCUITest for iOS, Espresso for Android
Phase 5: Performance testing - Battery, memory, network optimization
Phase 6: Continuous testing - Mobile CI/CD pipelines
projects: Build cross-platform test automation using Appium
Create native iOS test suite with XCUITest
Develop Android test automation with Espresso
mobile testing engineer.career_path: Mobile QA Engineer → Mobile Automation Engineer → Senior Mobile Engineer
mobile testing engineer.job_market: Growing demand with mobile app explosion
mobile testing engineer.notes: Mobile testing is increasingly critical. Understanding of both iOS and Android is valuable.

learning_path: Phase 1: Performance testing concepts - Load, stress, soak testing
Phase 2: JMeter fundamentals - Test plan creation, thread groups, assertions
Phase 3: Advanced JMeter - Timers, listeners, reporting
Phase 4: Analysis and optimization - Identifying bottlenecks, metrics
Phase 5: Cloud load testing - AWS, Azure testing services
Phase 6: Continuous performance testing - Baseline, regression detection
projects: Design and execute load test for e-commerce platform
Create spike test to verify system stability under sudden load
Build endurance test to check memory leaks over time
Analyze results and provide performance optimization recommendations
performance testing engineer.career_path: Performance Tester → Senior Performance Engineer → Performance Architect
performance testing engineer.job_market: Moderate demand, higher pay than functional QA
performance testing engineer.notes: Specialized skill with good earning potential. Critical for high-traffic applications.

learning_path: Phase 1: API fundamentals - REST, SOAP, HTTP methods, headers
Phase 2: Postman mastery - Collections, assertions, automation
Phase 3: Code-based testing - REST Assured with Java/Python
Phase 4: Advanced scenarios - Authentication, complex workflows
Phase 5: Performance testing for APIs - Load testing, rate limiting
Phase 6: API security testing - SQL injection, token validation
projects: Build comprehensive API test suite using Postman
Implement API automation framework with REST Assured
Create data-driven API tests with various payloads
Design and execute API load testing scenarios
api testing engineer.career_path: API QA Engineer → API Automation Engineer → Backend Test Engineer
api testing engineer.job_market: High demand with microservices and API-first architectures
api testing engineer.notes: API testing is crucial in microservices and cloud-native architectures. Growing demand.

learning_path: Fundamentals: Business operations, supply chain, organizational structure
Advanced processes: Resource planning, workflow optimization
Leadership: Team management, stakeholder communication
Analytics: Data-driven decision making, KPIs
Strategic: Operations strategy, scalability planning
Industry-specific: Compliance, regulations, best practices
business operations manager.career_path: Operations Coordinator → Operations Manager → Business Operations Manager → Operations Director
business operations manager.job_market: High demand in all industries; critical for growth-stage companies
business operations manager.notes: Non-IT role focused on business efficiency and organizational management

learning_path: Fundamentals: Databases, data structure, SQL basics
Querying: Advanced SQL, complex joins, aggregations
Analysis: Statistical methods, hypothesis testing, data interpretation
Visualization: Creating dashboards, storytelling with data
Tools: BI tools (Tableau, Power BI), automation, scripting
Business: KPIs, metrics definition, business intelligence
data analyst.career_path: Data Analyst → Senior Data Analyst → Analytics Manager → Director of Analytics
data analyst.job_market: High demand across all industries; essential for data-driven organizations
data analyst.notes: Non-coding focused role emphasizing communication and business understanding

learning_path: Fundamentals: Project management frameworks, PMBOK overview
Planning: Scope, schedule, budget, resource planning
Execution: Team coordination, communication, monitoring
Agile: Scrum, sprints, backlogs, ceremonies
Risk: Risk identification, mitigation strategies, issue management
Closure: Lessons learned, documentation, project completion
project manager.career_path: Project Coordinator → Project Manager → Senior PM → Program Manager → PMO Director
project manager.job_market: Consistent demand; larger organizations always need PMs
project manager.notes: Applicable across IT and non-IT industries; foundation for leadership roles

learning_path: Fundamentals: Sales process, product knowledge, industry domain
Technical: Product architecture, technical capabilities, integration options
Communication: Customer demos, technical presentations, documentation
Solutions: Solution selling, requirement mapping, proposal writing
Negotiation: Contract terms, technical requirements, pricing discussions
Account Management: Long-term relationships, upselling, customer success
sales engineer.career_path: Sales Development Rep → Sales Engineer → Senior Sales Engineer → Sales Manager → VP Sales
sales engineer.job_market: Very high demand in enterprise and SaaS companies
sales engineer.notes: Bridges gap between technical and sales teams; excellent career growth path

learning_path: Fundamentals: Scrum framework, ceremonies, roles, artifacts
Facilitation: Sprint planning, standup, review, retrospective management
Coaching: Team development, individual growth, mentoring
Impediments: Obstacle removal, conflict resolution, escalation
Metrics: Velocity tracking, burndown charts, team performance
Continuous Improvement: Process optimization, team effectiveness
projects: Sprint planning and backlog refinement facilitation
Retrospective facilitation and action items tracking
scrum master.career_path: Team Lead/Senior Developer → Scrum Master → Agile Coach → Agile Manager → Director of Agile
scrum master.job_market: High demand; every tech company needs Scrum Masters
scrum master.notes: Servant leader role focused on team effectiveness and process improvement
